stories.text:
I'm getting tired of having to buy charging cables every few months for my kids' devices (in this case iPads, but could really be any device).

Cables that come with devices are typically crap (they fray just looking at them) and never last, but it seems like most third-party cables aren't much better (they just stop working after a while).

Are there really good quality device charging cables out there? What do you use?
stories.title: Ask HN: Any good quality device charging cables?
Credit Suisse securitises yacht loans to oligarchs and tycoons

stories.text:
In Latin America is not common to share salary information many times even between good acquaintances . There are consulting services for companies that share specific salaries and benefits by role and with details on years of experience, that way companies can try to keep up with the market. But there is no such tool available for the public, at least in latam, to my knowledge.

I am thinking on building such a database but a few questions arised:

1. Do you believe glassdoor and similar services have brought more visibility on salary to the US? 2. how to detect bogus input? 3. is there a similar solution that is already available?
stories.title: Ask HN: About Salary Equality and Information Access
The salary ignorance that keeps many workers underpaid
The 'Bitcoin Family' immigrates to Portugal for its 0% tax on cryptocurrencies
California rooftop solar proposal sparks firestorm
Our Nation Cannot Censor Its Way Back to Cultural Health
